item.title: Jimmy Carter Accuses U.S. of 'Widespread Abuse of Human Rights'
item.description: Jimmy Carter Accuses U.S. of 'Widespread Abuse of Human Rights' http://t.co/Ke1lLCto #humanrights #news
item.content:encoded: Jimmy Carter Accuses U.S. of 'Widespread Abuse of Human Rights' http://t.co/Ke1lLCto #humanrights #news From Yahoo! News: A former U.S. president is accusing the current president of sanctioning the “widespread abuse of human rights” by authorizing drone strikes to kill suspected terrorists. Jimmy Carter, America’s 39th president, denounced the Obama administration for “clearly violating” 10 of the 30 articles of  the Universal... Link - Trackbacks

item.title: How Many Deceptive NBC Edits Before Steve Capus Is Fired?
item.description: How Many Deceptive NBC Edits Before Steve Capus Is Fired? http://t.co/l8XDmFCg
item.content:encoded: How Many Deceptive NBC Edits Before Steve Capus Is Fired? http://t.co/l8XDmFCg If you look at the timeline here, you'll see that the frequency of these fraudulent edits is increasing at a rapid rate. Which is probably no accident when you consider how close we are to voting Obama out of office. In summation: NBC's brand is in trouble, the man behind the decline just got his contract renewed, and the frequency of brand-tarnishing frauds is increasing. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com
